 gestures seeming virtue sat
 toward imperial tent asked way
 met bold lovesome knight
 lord godfrey's youngest brother eustace hight

 xxxiv
 fowl first fell snare
 saw fair hoped find kind
 throne cupid easy stair
 bark fit sail every wind
 breach makes wisdom repair
 reverence meet baron low inclined
 thus purpose virgin told
 youth use nature made bold

 xxxv
 "lady thee beseem stile low
 whose sweet looks sacred beauty shine
 never yet heaven grace bestow
 daughter born adam's line
 thy name let us though far unworthy know
 unfold thy whence thou art fine
 lest audacious boldness learn late
 honors due become thy high estate"

 xxxvi
 "sir knight" quoth "your praises reach high
 merit commenden
 hapless maid born die
 dead joy live care woe
 virgin helpless fugitive pardie
 native soil kingdom thus forego
 seek duke godfrey's aid store men tell
 virtuous ruth doth bosom dwell

 xxxvii
 "conduct mighty duke
 courteous sir well seem"
 "content" quoth "since one womb ybore
 brothers fortune good esteem
 encounter whose word prevaileth
 godfrey's hearing haply deem
 mine aid grant promise
 sceptre sword do"

 xxxviii
 led easily forth said
 godfrey sat among lords peers
 reverence blushed one dismayed
 speak secret wants inward fears
 seemed bashful shame speeches stayed
 last courteous duke gently cheers
 silence made began tale
 sit hear thus sung nightingale

 xxxix
 "victorious prince whose honorable name
 held great among pagan kings
 lands thou dost conquest tame
 thou hast content brings
 well known thy immortal fame
 earth thy worth thy foe thy praises sings
 paynims wronged come seek thine aid
 doth thy virtue thy power persuade

 xl
 "and though bred macon's heathenish lore
 thou oppressest thy puissant might
 yet trust thou wilt helpless maid restore
 repossess father's right
 others distress aid implore
 kin friends sad plight
 invoke thy help kingdom invade
 doth thy virtue need persuade

 xli
 "in thee hope thy succors invoke
 win crown whence dispossest
 like renown awaiteth stroke
 cast haughty raise opprest
 greater glory brings sceptre broke
 doth deliverance maid distrest
 since thou canst perform thing
 thy praise make kill king

 xlii
 "but thou would'st thy succors due excuse
 christ hope trust
 ah yet virtue's sake thy virtue use
 scorneth gold lies dust
 witness heaven thou grant refuse
 thou dost forsake maid cause
 thou shalt large fortunes know
 wrongs great treasons show

 xliii
 "prince arbilan reigned life
 fair damascus noble sire
 born mean race yet got wife
 queen chariclia fire
 hot love soon fatal knife
 cut thread kept joys entire
 mishap cruel lot cast
 birth death first day last

 xliv
 "and ere five years fully come gone
 since dear spouse hasty death yield
 father also died consumed moan
 sought love amid elysian fields
 crown poor orphan left alone
 mine uncle governed tender eild
 well thought mortal men faith
 brother's breast true love mansion hath

 xlv
 "he took charge crown
 kind shows love brought pass
 damascus great report blown
 good kind mine uncle
 whether kept wicked hate unknown
 hid serpent flowering grass
 true faith bosom
 meant match son

 xlvi
 "which son within short undertake
 degree knighthood beseemed well
 yet never durst lady's sake
 break sword lance advance lofty sell
 fair citherea's make
 proud signoriseth hell
 fashions wayward love unkind
 cupid deigns wound currish mind

 xlvii
 "this paragon queen armida wed
 goodly swain princess' fere
 lovely partner lady's bed
 noble head golden crown wear
 glosing sire errand daily said
 sugared speeches whispered mine ear
 make take darling mine arms
 still adder stopt ears charms

 xlviii
 "at last left troubled grace
 transparent inward spite
 methought read story face
 mishaps since light
 since foul spirits haunt restingplace
 ghastly visions break sleep night
 grief horror fear fainting soul kill
 mind foreshowed coming ill

 xlix
 "three times shape dear mother came
 pale sad dismayed warn dream
 alas far transformed
 whose eyes shone erst like titan's glorious beam
 'daughter' says 'fly fly behold thy dame
 foreshows treasons thy wretched eame
 poison gainst thy harmless life provides'
 said shapeless air unseen glides

 l
 "but avail high walls bulwarks strong
 fainting cowards piece guard
 sex weak mine age young
 undertake alone work hard
 wander wild desert woods among
 banished maid wonted ease debarred
 grievous seemed liefer death
 expire first drew breath

 li
 "i feared deadly evil long stayed
 yet fly neither power
 durst heart declare waxed afraid
 lest hasten might dying hour
 thus restless waited unhappy maid
 hand first pluck springing flower
 even wretch condemned lose life
 awaits falling murdering knife

 lii
 "in extremes fortune would
 perchance preserve ill
 one noble father's servants old
 goodness bore child good
 store tears treason gan unfold
 said guardian would pupil kill
 promise made kept
 give poison dire ere next slept

 liii
 "and told wished live
 must convey secret flight
 offered succours could give
 aid mistress banished right
 words comfort fear exile drive
 dread death made lesser dangers light
 concluded shadows dim
 obscured earth depart

 liv
 "of close escapes aged patroness
 blacker erst sable mantle spread
 two trusty maids great distress
 mine uncle realm fled
 oft looked back hardly could suppress
 streams tears mine eyes uncessant shed
 looked kingdom lost
 grief death hell almost

 lv
 "my steeds drew burden limbs
 still locks thoughts drew back fast
 fare men heaven's brims
 far sea sudden storm cast
 swift o'er grass rolling chariot swims
 ways unknown night day haste
 last nigh tired castle strong fand
 utmost border native land

 lvi
 "the fort arontes knight
 called deliverance thus wrought
 tyrant saw mature flight
 escaped treasons thought
 rage increased cursed wight
 gainst safety brought
 us accused would poisoned
 descried save lives fled

 lvii
 "and lieu approved truth
 poison hired guide
 despatched mine unbridled youth
 might rage subjection tied
 night slepto foul untruth
 mine honor lost arontes' side
 heaven pray send revenging fire
 base love shall change chaste desire

 lviii
 "not sitteth regal throne
 thirst drink lukewarm blood
 grieveth despite alone
 renown ever blameless stood
 hath lost light wherewith always shone
 forged lies makes tale good
 holds subjects' hearts suspense
 none take armor queen's defence

 lix
 "and though regal throne possess
 clothed purple crowned burnished gold
 yet hate rancor ne'er less
 since naught assuageth malice 'tis old
 threats burn arontes' forteress
 murder unless yield hold
 mine threats war death
 thus causeless hatred endless uneath

 lx
 "and trusts wash away stain
 hide shameful fact mine offence
 saith restore throne
 late honor due excellence
 therefore would algates slain
 live right suspense
 cause guiltless life sought
 ruin safety wrought

 lxi
 "and let tyrant heart's desire
 let perform cruelty meant
 guiltless blood must quench ceaseless fire
 endless tears bootless spent
 unless thou help thee renowned sire
 fly virgin orphan innocent
 let tears thy feet distil
 redeem drops blood thirsts spill

 lxii
 "by thy glorious feet tread secure
 necks tyrants thy conquests brave
 right hand temples pure
 thou seek'st free macon's lore crave
 help sickness none thou canst cure
 life kingdom let thy mercy save
 death ruin vain prove thee
 right truth justice cannot move thee

 lxiii
 "thou dost thou wishest thy
 never willest aught right
 preserve guiltless blood seek spill
 thine kingdom save thy might
 among captains lords knights skill
 appoint ten approved fight
 assistance friends kin
 may serve kingdom lost win

 lxiv
 "for lo knight gate ward
 man chiefest trust king
 hath promised beguile guard
 mine undertakes bring
 safe tyrant haply sleepeth hard
 counselled undertake thing
 little succor intreat
 whose name alone accomplish feat"

 lxv
 said answer nymph attend
 looks sighs gestures pray
 godfrey wisely grant suspend
 doubts worst awhile stay
 knows fears god loves friend
 fears heathen false would thus betray
 yet ruth dwelt princely mind
 gainst wisdom pity made kind

 lxvi
 besides kindness gentle thought
 ready comfort distressed wight
 maiden's offer profit brought
 syrian kingdom right
 way easy sought
 bring asia subject might
 might raise munition arms treasure
 work egyptian king displeasure

 lxvii
 thus noble heart long time betwixt
 fear remorse granting denying
 upon eyes dame lookings fixed
 life death lay saying
 tears shed sighs sobbings mixed
 hopes dead delaying
 last earnest suit duke denayed
 sweet words thus would content maid

 lxviii
 "if service god fought
 meaner quarrel sword shaken
 well might thou gather thy gentle thought
 fair princess forsaken
 since armies world's end brought
 free sacred town undertaken
 unfit turned strength away
 victory even coming stay

 lxix
 "i promise thee princely word
 burden thy wish hope repose
 chosen temple lord
 holy doors shall saints unclose
 rest peace victorious sword
 shall execute due vengeance thy foes
 pity worldly dame
 left work pity shame"

 lxx
 princess bent eyes ground
 stood unmoved though unmarked space
 secret bleeding inward wound
 shed heavenly dew upon angel's face
 "poor wretch" quoth "in tears sorrows drowned
 death thy peace grave thy restingplace
 since thy hap lest thou mercy find
 gentlest heart earth proved unkind

 lxxi
 "where none attends boots complain
 men's froward hearts moved women's tears
 marble stones pierced drops rain
 plaints find passage unwilling ears
 tyrant haply would wraith restrain
 heard prayers ruthless godfrey hears
 yet thy fault chance see
 hath made even pity pitiless thee

 lxxii
 "so thy goodness good hap denayed
 grief sorrow mischief care hath overthrown
 star ruled birthday hath betrayed
 genius sees charge dares
 queenlike state flight hath disarrayed
 father died ere five years known
 kingdom lost lastly resteth
 tree sith broke every bough

 lxxiii
 "and modest lore maidenhood
 bids sojourn armed men
 whither shall fly secret wood
 shall hide tyrant den
 rock vault cave good
 death sure resteth
 scorn power therefore seen
 armida lived died like queen"

 lxxiv
 looked proud disdain
 kindled displeasure noble mind
 way came turned steps
 gesture sad disdainful kind
 tempest railed cheeks amain
 tears woe sighs anger's wind
 drops footsteps wash whereon treads
 seems step pearls crystal beads

 lxxv
 cheeks streaming nectar fell
 stilled limbeck diamond eyes
 roses white red resembled well
 whereon rory maydew sprinkled lies
 fair morn first blusheth cell
 breatheth balm opened paradise
 thus sighed thus mourned thus wept lovely queen
 drop bathed grace unseen

 lxxvi
 thrice twenty cupids unperceived flew
 gather liquor ere fall
 drop arrow forged new
 else came snatched crystal ball
 rebellious hearts wildfire threw
 wondrous love thou makest gain
 weeping sit smiling stand
 bends thy bow kindleth else thy brand

 lxxvii
 forged plaint drew forth unfeigned tears
 many eyes pierced worthy's heart
 one condoleth hears
 grief would help bear smart
 godfrey aid one swears
 tigress gave suck roughest part
 midst rude crags alpine cliffs aloft
 hard heart beauty makes soft

 lxxviii
 jolly eustace whose breast brand
 love pity kindled flame
 others softly whispered underhand
 duke comely boldness came
 "brother lord" quoth "too long stand
 first purpose yet vouchsafe frame
 thoughts lend virgin aid
 thanks half lost good turns delayed

 lxxix
 "and think eustace's talk assays
 turn forces present war
 wish armies raise
 sion's walls speech tends far
 venture fame praise
 charge service bounden
 forth troop may ten well spared
 succor naught weaken thee

 lxxx
 "and know shall god's high service fight
 virgins innocent save defend
 dear spoils heaven's sight
 tyrant's hateful head rend
 seemed forward lady's right
 hope gain profit end
 know arms unworthy bears
 help maiden's cause shuns fears

 lxxxi
 "ah pardie declared france
 elsewhere told courtesy prize
 forsook fair chevisance
 doubt fear might fight arise
 else surrender sword lance
 swear use martial guise
 ill deserves termed knight
 bears blunt sword lady's right"

 lxxxii
 thus parleyed confused sound
 rest approved gallant said
 general knights encompassed round
 humble grace earnest suit prayed
 "i yield" quoth "and happy found
 granted let aid
 thanks danger
 aught succeed much fear amiss

 lxxxiii
 "but words may credit find
 oh temper heat misguides so"
 thus much said fancy blind
 accept grant let counsel go
 works beauty man's relenting mind
 eath move plaints shows woe
 lips cast forth chain sugared words
 captive led christian lords

 lxxxiv
 eustace recalled bespake thus
 "beauty's chief darling let sorrows
 assistance shall find us
 need may best agree"
 cheered forehead dolorous
 smiled joy phoebus blushed see
 deigned veil remove
 god fallen love

 lxxxv
 broke silence
 gave knight great thanks little speech
 said would handmaid poor remain
 far honor's laws received breach
 humble gestures made residue plain
 dumb eloquence persuading speech
 thus women know thus use guise
 enchant valiant beguile wise

 lxxxvi
 saw enterprise got
 wished mean quick good proceeding
 thought strike iron hot
 every action hath hour speeding
 medea false circe changed
 far shapes men eyes spreading
 altered hearts syren's sound
 lust minds hearts love drowned

 lxxxvii
 wily sleights subtle women know
 hourly used catch lover new
 none kenned bent unsteadfast bow
 time thoughts looks renew
 cast modest eyes
 gazing glances roving flew
 thus pursued wanton sport
 spurred slow reined forward short

 lxxxviii
 hopeless would
 forebore love durst move
 gentle looks smile begun
 say kind dare prove
 every heart thus shone lustful sun
 strove serve please woo love
 hearts chaste bashful
 eye's hot glance dissolved frost fear

 lxxxix
 durst fingering bold assay
 touch softness tender skin
 looked coy list play
 made things worth hard win
 yet tempered deignful looks alway
 outward scorn showed store grace within
 thus false hope longing hearts fired
 hardest gotten things desired

 xc
 alone sometimes walked secret
 ruminate upon discontent
 within eyelids sate swelling tear
 poured forth though sprung sad lament
 craft thousand souls well near
 snares foolish ruth love hent
 kept slaves fitly prove
 witless pity breedeth fruitless love

 xci
 sometimes hope unloosed
 chains grief wherein thoughts lay fettered
 upon minions looked blithe glad
 deceitful lore lettered
 glorious titan brightness clad
 sunshine face lustre bettered
 list cheer beauties
 smiled away clouds grief woe

 xcii
 double charm smiles sugared words
 lulled sleep virtue senses
 reason shall aid gainst assaults affords
 wisdom warrant sweet offences
 cupid's deep rivers shallow fords
 griefs bring joys losses recompenses
 breeds sore cures us pain
 achilles' lance wounds heals

 xciii
 thus torments twixt frost fire
 twixt joy grief twixt hope restless fear
 sly enchantress felt gain nigher
 flocks golden fleeces bear
 someone durst utter desire
 complaining make griefs appear
 labored hard rocks plaints move
 learned gamut love

 xciv
 bet bashful eyes ground
 donned weed women's modest grace
 eyes welled pearls round
 upon bright enamel face
 honey drops springing flowers found
 phoebus holds crimson morn chase
 full seemed looks anger shame
 yet pity shone transparent

 xcv
 perceived outward cheer
 would love talk bewray
 sometimes heard sometimes stopped ear
 played fast loose livelong day
 thus lovers kind deluded
 earnest suit got neither yea nay
 like sort weary huntsmen fare
 hunt day lose night hare

 xcvi
 arts captived
 thousand souls young lusty knights
 arms wherewith love conquered
 feeble hearts subdued wanton fights
 wonder achilles misled
 great alcides ladies' sights
 since true champions lord
 thralls beauty yielden slaves lore



 fifth book

 argument
 gernando scorns rinaldo aspire
 rule charge seeks strives
 slanders far ire
 wronged knight foe life deprives
 far camp slayer doth retire
 lets bound chains gyves
 armide departs content seas
 godfrey hears news displease



 thus armida false knights misled
 wandering errors deceitful love
 thought besides champions promised
 lordlings aid move
 godfrey's thought strong contention bred
 fittest hazard great prove
 worthies adventures' band
 like birth power strength hand

 ii
 first prince grave advice decreed
 knight choose election
 charge lord dudon might succeed
 glorious troop take protection
 none grieve displeased deed
 blame causer new subjection
 besides godfredo showed device
 much held regiment price

 iii
 called worthies spake
 "lordlings know yielded
 gave license dame go
 win kingdom tyrant kill
 let know
 following may betide yon ill
 refrain therefore change forward thought
 death unsent danger comes unsought

 iv
 "but shun perils sought far
 may seem disgraceful place yon hold
 grave advice prudent counsel
 esteemed detractors courage bold
 know none debar
 granted erst withhold
 mine empire ought right
 sweet easy pleasant gentle meek light

 v
 "go tarry likes best
 free power grant enterprise
 first dudon's place laid chest
 choose captain stout wise
 ten appoint among worthiest
 let attempt hard emprise
 content
 power constrained glorious slave"

 vi
 thus godfrey said thus brother spake
 answered peers
 "my lord well fitteth thee make
 wise delays cast doubts fears
 'tis part first undertake
 courage haste beseems might years
 proceeding grave advice
 wisdom us cowardice

 vii
 "since feat easy danger none
 set battle hardy fight
 thou permit chosen ten gone
 aid damsel" thus devised knight
 make men think sun honor shone
 lamp cupid gave light
 rest perceive guile approve
 call knighthood childish love

 viii
 loving eustace jealous eye
 beheld worth sophia's noble child
 fair shape secretly envy
 besides virtues breast compiled
 love would company
 stored mouth speeches smoothly filed
 drawing rival attend word
 thus fair sleight laid knight abord

 ix
 "of great bertoldo thou far greater heir
 thou star knighthood flower chivalry
 tell shall lead squadron fair
 since late guide marble cold doth lie
 famous dudon might compare
 years hoar locks gravity
 duke godfrey's brother yield
 unless thee christian army's shield

 x
 "thee high birth makes equal best
 thine acts prefer beforn
 fight thou surpass rest
 godfrey's worthy self hold scorn
 thee obey pressed
 worthies thine eagle borne
 honor haply thou esteemest light
 whose day glory never yet found night

 xi
 "yet mayest thou means display
 spreading wings thy immortal fame
 procure thou sayest nay
 wills thine election frame
 scantly resolved way
 bend force employ
 leave pray discretion free
 help armida serve thee"

 xii
 last request love evil hide
 empurpled cheeks scarlet red
 rinaldo soon passions descried
 gently smiling turned aside head
 weak cupid feeble eyed
 strike sure fire dead
 rivals naught afraid
 cared journey maid

 xiii
 noble thought revolved oft
 dudon's high prowess death burial
 argantes bore plumes aloft
 praising fortunes worthy's fall
 besides knight's sweet words praises soft
 due honor fitly call
 made heart rejoice well knew
 though much praised words true

 xiv
 "degrees" quoth "of honors high hold
 would first deserve desire
 valor told
 would higher place aspire
 honors due raise would
 works refuse hire
 much glads power might
 ypraised valiant knight

 xv
 "i neither seek refuse place
 get praise thanks thine"
 eustace spoken hied thence apace
 know way fellows' hearts incline
 prince gernando coveted place
 though armida sought undermine
 gainst yet vain engines prove
 pride place love

 xvi
 gernando king norway's son
 many realm region guide
 elders lands crowns
 heart puffed endless pride
 boasts done
 ancestors' great acts beside
 yet forefathers old
 famous war peace five hundred years

 xvii
 barbarous prince vainly thought
 bliss wealth kingly power doth lie
 respect esteemed virtue naught
 unless adorned titles high
 could endure place sought
 simple knight dare press nigh
 breast boiled fell despite
 ire wrath exiled reason quite

 xviii
 hidden devil lies close await
 win fort unbelieving man
 found entry ire undid gate
 bosom unperceived ran
 filled heart malice strife hate
 made rage blaspheme swear curse ban
 invisible still attends near
 thus minute whispereth ear

 xix
 shall rinaldo match thee dares tell
 idle names vain pedigree
 let say thee would excel
 lands realms tributaries
 forefathers graves dwell
 honored like thine live let see
 oh dares one mean aspire high
 born servile country italy

 xx
 win lose day
 yet praise glory hence derived
 world credit say
 lo gernando strived
 charge deal thee haply honor may
 noble dudon lived
 laid would office shame
 let suffice durst desire

 xxi
 breath man's frail body flies
 soul take keep know things done
 oh looks dudon glorious skies
 wrath anger face appear
 proud youngling bends eyes
 marking high doth feathers rear
 seeing rash attempt soon dare
 though boy great worth compare

 xxii
 dares strives proves
 chastisement fit wins praise
 one counsels speech forward moves
 another fool approveth says
 godfrey favor behoves
 wrongeth thee hundred ways
 let thy state far disgraced
 thou art canst let godfrey see

 xxiii
 false words kindled fire began
 every vein poisoned heart reach
 swelled scornful heart forth ran
 proud looks audacious speech
 thought blameworthy man
 disgrace would preach
 termed proud vain worth fight
 called foolhardise rashness madness right

 xxiv
 rare excellent
 good princely found
 sharp words malice could invent
 blamed power wicked tongue wound
 youth everywhere rumors went
 reproaches heard sometimes sound
 tongue fault amend
 brought woful end

 xxv
 cursed fiend set tongue large
 still bred fancies idle brain
 heart slanders new overcharge
 soothed still angry vein
 amid camp place broad large
 one fair regiment might easily train
 tilt harmless tournament
 days rest youths gallants spent

 xxvi
 fortune would betide
 amid press gernando gan retire
 vomit venom unespied
 wherewith foul envy heart inspire
 rinaldo heard stood beside
 could bridle wrath ire
 "thou liest" cried loud word
 head tossed flaming sword

 xxvii
 thunder voice lightning seemed brand
 fell look furious cheer
 gernando trembled saw hand
 pale death neither help comfort near
 yet soldiers witness stand
 made proud sign though naught fear
 bravely drew littlehelping blade
 valiant show strong resistance made

 xxviii
 thousand blades burnished steel
 glistered heaps like flames fire sight
 hundreds knew yet quarrel weel
 ran thither gaze fight
 empty air sound confused feel
 murmurs low outcries loud height
 like rolling waves boreas' angry blasts
 roaring seas rocks casts

 xxix
 wronged warrior stayed
 displeasure incensed ire
 cared vulgar said
 vengeance courage fierce aspire
 among thickest weapons way made
 thundering sword made heaps retire
 near thousand stayed one
 prince gernando bore brunt alone

 xxx
 hand quick execute wrath
 performed pleased eye heart
 head breast oft times strucken hath
 right part
 every side thus harm scath
 oft beguile sight nimble art
 defence prince wounds acquits
 least thinks fears hits

 xxxi
 ceased till gernando's breast
 sheathed twice furious blade
 fell hapless prince death oppressed
 double way weak soul made
 bloody sword victor wiped dressed
 longer slaughtered body stayed
 sped thence soon appeased hath
 hate ire rancor wrath

 xxxii
 called tumult godfrey drew near
 beheld sad rueful sight
 signs death upon face appear
 dust blood locks loathly dight
 sighs complaints side might hear
 made sudden death great knight
 amazed asked durst much
 yet knew fault would touch

 xxxiii
 arnoldo minion prince thus slain
 augments fault telling saith
 prince murdered quarrel vain
 young rinaldo desperate wrath
 sword christ's law maintain
 one christ's champions bold killed hath
 place hour
 scorned rule despised power

 xxxiv
 adds deserved death
 law law inviolate
 none offence could greater uneath
 yet place fault aggravate
 escapes mischief would take breath
 flourish bold spite rule state
 gernando's friends would venge wrong
 although justice first belong

 xxxv
 means discord hate strife
 raise mutinies therefore ensueth
 lastly praised dead still rife
 words thought could vengeance move rut
 tancred argued life
 honest reasons excuse youth
 duke heard sober cheer
 banished hope still increased fear

 xxxvi
 "great prince" quoth tancred "set thine eyes
 rinaldo's worth courage
 much hope conquest lies
 regard princely house race
 correcteth every fault spies
 judgeth alike doth amiss
 faults know greater thought less
 person's self doth transgress"

 xxxvii
 godfredo answered "if high low
 sovereign power alike feel stroke
 tancred ill counsel us trow
 lords know law erst spoke
 vile base empire know
 none slaves peasants bear yoke
 weak sceptre power small
 provisos bring annexed withal

 xxxviii
 "but mine freely given ere 'twas sought
 lessened consent
 right well know ought
 give condign reward punishment
 since like subjection brought
 high low obey content"
 heard tancredi wisely stayed words
 weight sayings kings lords

 xxxix
 old raymond praised speech old men think
 ever wisest seem severe
 "'tis best" quoth "to make great ones shrink
 people love nobles fear
 must rule disorders sink
 pardons punishments appear
 feeble kingdom frail weak
 unless basis fear speak"

 xl
 words tancredi heard pondered well
 wist godfrey's thoughts bent
 list longer old men dwell
 turned horse rinaldo went
 noble foe deathwounded fell
 withdrew softly gorgeous tent
 tancred found large declared
 words speeches sharp late heard

 xli
 said "although wot outward show
 true witness secret thought
 men subtle trow
 purpose appeareth naught
 yet dare say godfredo means know
 knowledge hath looks speeches wrought
 shall first prisoner tried
 shall deem good law provide"

 xlii
 bitter smile well might see
 rinaldo cast scorn high disdain
 "let fetters plead cause" quoth
 "that base peasants born servile stain
 free born live die free
 feet fettered chain
 hands made shake sharp spears swords
 tied gyves twisted cords

 xliii
 "if good service reap recompense
 clapt close secret mew
 thief dragged thence
 suffer punishment law finds due
 let godfrey come send hence
 know shall bargain rue
 tragedy late done fact
 may first second act

 xliv
 "give mine arms" cried squire brings
 clad head dressed iron strong
 neck silver shield flings
 side cutting sword hung
 among earth's brave lords mighty kings
 none stout fierce fair young
 god mars seemed descending sphere
 one whose looks could make great mars fear

 xlv
 tancredi labored pleasing speech
 spirits fierce courage appease
 "young prince thy valor" thus gan preach
 "can chastise thee wrong ease
 know virtue enemies teach
 venge please
 god forbid day lift arm
 camp us friends harm

 xlvi
 "tell would stain
 noble hands unguilty blood
 wounding christians
 pierce christ whose parts members good
 destroy us glory vain
 unstayed rolling waves ocean flood
 far prove strength
 let zeal appease rage length

 xlvii
 "for god's love stay heat displeasure
 appease wrath courage fierce assuage
 patience praise forbearance treasure
 suffrance angel's monster rage
 least actions example measure
 think mine unbridled age
 wronged yet would revengement take
 camp one offender's sake

 xlviii
 "cilicia conquered men wot
 glorious cross high reared
 baldwin came nobly got
 bereft falsely least feared
 seemed friend discovered
 secret covetise since appeared
 yet strive get mine fight
 civil war although perchance might

 xlix
 "if scorn prison pent
 bonds high disgrace hands refuse
 thoughts still maintain bent
 liberty men honor use
 antioch forthwith went
 leave absence excuse
 prince boemond live ease peace
 storm godfrey's anger cease

 l
 "for soon forces come egypt land
 nations us confine
 godfrey beaten wand
 feel wants valor great thine
 camp may seem arm without hand
 amid troops unless thy eagle shine"
 came guelpho words approved
 prayed go feared loved

 li
 speeches soften much warrior's heart
 make wilful thoughts last relent
 yields saith depart
 leave christian camp incontinent
 friends whose love never shrink start
 preferred aid way soe'er went
 thanked left besides
 two bold trusty squires rides

 lii
 rides revolving noble spright
 haughty thoughts fill glorious mind
 hard adventures whole delight
 wondrous acts inclined
 alone pagans would fight
 kill kings egypt unto inde
 cynthia's hills nilus' unknown spring
 would fetch praise glorious conquest bring

 liii
 guelpho prince leave take
 spurred courser way
 longer tarriance rest would make
 tastes find godfredo may
 seeing approaching forthwith spake
 "guelpho" quoth "for thee stay
 thee sent heralds
 every tent seek find thee out"

 liv
 said softly drew knight aside
 none might hear bespake thus
 "how chanceth thy nephew's rage pride
 makes far forget us
 hardly could believe betide
 murder done cause frivolous
 loved thou tell
 godfrey loved whilst well

 lv
 "i must provide every one right
 heard cause well discussed
 far partial love free spite
 hear complaints yet naught proves trust
 rinaldo weigh rule light
 sacred lore war brust
 take charge us come
 clear hear upright dome

 lvi
 "but let come withouten bond chain
 still thoughts grace framed
 power haply shall disdain
 well know courage yet untamed
 bring persuasion take pain
 else prove severe blamed
 forced gentle nature gainst thought
 rigor lest laws return naught"

 lvii
 lord guelpho answered thus "what heart bear
 slanders false devised hate spite
 stayed patience reproaches hear
 revenge battle fight
 norway prince hath bought folly dear
 words could stay angry knight
 fool comes preach prate
 men swords right wrong debate

 lviii
 "and wish submit
 hear censure upright laws
 alas cannot flit
 camp withouten stay pause
 take gage behold offer
 first accused cause
 else dare maintain
 pride prince justly slain

 lix
 "i say reason lord gernando's pride
 hath abated offended
 gainst commands lord guide
 oh pardon fault shall amended"
 "if gone" quoth godfrey "let ride
 brawl elsewhere let strife ended
 lord guelpho nephew's sake
 breed us new quarrels old awake"

 lx
 fair false armida strived
 get promised aid sure possession
 day end endless plaint derived
 wit beauty craft made intercession
 earth light deprived
 western seas felt titan's hot impression
 'twixt two old knights matrons twain went
 pitched fair curious tent

 lxi
 false queen craft sly invention
 whose looks love's arrows whose eyes quivers
 whose beauty matchless free reprehension
 wonder left heaven afterlivers
 among christian lord bred contention
 first quench flames cupid's rivers
 weapons darts rehearsed
 godfredo's constant bosom pierced

 lxii
 change modest thought dame procureth
 proffereth heaps love's enticing treasure
 falcon newly gorged endureth
 keeper lure oft comes leisure
 fulness delight assureth
 long repentance comes love's short pleasure
 crafts arts despiseth
 base affections fall virtue riseth

 lxiii
 one foot steadfast foot moved
 heavenly path wherein paced
 yet thousand wiles thousand ways proved
 castle fair goodness raised
 used looks smiles behoved
 melt frost hard heart embraced
 gainst breast thousand shot ventured
 yet fort strong entered

 lxiv
 dame thought one blink eye
 could make chastest heart feel love's sweet pain
 oh pride abated hereby
 sleights void crafts vain
 would forces try
 ease might vantage gain
 tired soldiers fort keeps
 thence raise siege spoil towns

 lxv
 yet ways wily witch could find
 could tancredi's heart loveward move
 sails filled another wind
 list blast new affection prove
 one poison doth exclude kind
 another's force love excludeth love
 two alone less dame
 could win rest burnt sweet flame

 lxvi
 princess though purpose would frame
 late hoped still would
 yet lords knights greatest name
 became prey erst heard told
 thought ere truthrevealing time frame
 bewrayed act lead hold
 chains band meant make prove
 composed vulcan gentle love

 lxvii
 time prefixed length come past
 godfrey set lend aid
 feet earth cast
 "the hour come lord" humbly said
 "and tyrant haply hear last
 banished niece hath assistance prayed
 arms save kingdom rise
 shall harder make enterprise

 lxviii
 "before report bring tyrant news
 espials certify king
 oh let thy goodness champions choose
 kingdom thy handmaid bring
 except heaven aid right refuse
 recover shall crown whence shall spring
 thy profit betide thee peace war
 thine cities subjects are"

 lxix
 captain sage damsel fair assured
 word passed recanted
 sweet humble grace endured
 let point ten late granted
 one one fought procured
 suit entreaty intercession wanted
 envy others' love exceeded
 importunate made needed

 lxx
 well saw secret hearts
 knew best warm blood
 threw cursed poisoned darts
 jealousy grief others' good
 love wist weak without arts
 slow jealousy cupid's food
 swift steed runs fast alone
 strain strive outgone

 lxxi
 words alluring sort framed
 looks enticing wooing smiles
 every one fellows' favors blamed
 mistress received erewhiles
 foolish crew lovers unashamed
 mad poison secret wiles
 ran forward still disordered sort
 could godfredo's bridle rein short

 lxxii
 would satisfy good desire
 withouten partial love every knight
 although swelled shame grief ire
 see fellows fashions light
 yet since advice would retire
 another way sought set right
 "write names" quoth "and see chance
 lot exploit first advance"

 lxxiii
 names writ helmet shaken
 fortune's grace aid implore
 last drew foremost taken
 earl pembroke artemidore
 doubtless county thought bread well baken
 next gerrard followed tresses hoar
 old wenceslaus felt cupid's rage
 doating dying age

 lxxiv
 oh contentment foreheads shined
 looks joy thoughts swelled secret pleasure
 three seemed good success designed
 make lords love beauty's treasure
 doubtful fellows hap repined
 small patience wait fortune's leisure
 upon lips read scrolls attending
 lives words depending

 lxxv
 guasco fourth ridolpho succeeds
 ulderick love list advance
 lord william ronciglion next reads
 eberard henry born france
 rambaldo last wicked lust leads
 forsook saviour mischance
 wretch tenth thus deluded
 rest huge grief excluded

 lxxvi
 o'ercome envy wrath jealousy
 rest blind fortune curse laws
 mad love yet love cry
 kingdom let judge cause
 man's mind oft try
 things forbidden without stay pause
 spite fortune purposed many knight
 follow fair armida 'twas night

 lxxvii
 follow night else day
 quarrel venture life limb
 sighs tears gan softly pray
 keep promise skies dim
 knight plain say
 grief felt part withouten
 meanwhile ten donned armor best
 taken leave godfrey rest

 lxxviii
 duke advised every one apart
 light trustless pagan's faith
 told policy wit art
 avoids deceit heedless men betray'th
 speeches pierce ear heart
 love calls folly whatso wisdom saith
 thus warned leaves wanton guide
 parts night haste ride

 lxxix
 conqueress departs led
 prisoners love would captive keep
 hearts left behind bled
 point sorrow's arrow pierced deep
 night drowsy mantle spread
 filled earth silence shade sleep
 secret sort forsook tent
 blind cupid led blind went

 lxxx
 eustatio first scantly could forbear
 till friendly night might hide haste shame
 rode post let breast bear
 blind fancy would journey frame
 night wandered wist
 morning espied dame
 guard village rode
 night made abode

 lxxxi
 thither galloped fast drawing near
 rambaldo knew knight loudly cried
 "whence comes young eustace seeks here"
 "i come" quoth "to serve queen armide
 accept would
 goodwill faith might best tried"
 "who" quoth "choseth thee prove
 high exploit hers" answered "love"

 lxxxii
 "love hath eustatio chosen fortune thee
 thy conceit best election"
 "nay shifts vain" replied
 "these titles false serve thee protection
 thou canst admitted
 fellowservant sweet subjection"
 "and who" quoth eustace angry "dares deny
 fellowship" rambaldo answered "i"

 lxxxiii
 word cutting sword drew
 glittered bright sparkled flaming fire
 upon foe champion flew
 equal courage equal ire
 gentle princess danger knew
 stepped prayed retire
 "rambald" quoth "why grudge plain
 champion helper gain

 lxxxiv
 "if love wish deprived
 great need puissant knight
 welcome eustace good time arrived
 defender state life right
 wish hapless self longer lived
 esteem good assistance light"
 thus talked travelled way
 fellowship increasing every day

 lxxxv
 every side come yet wist none
 others coming others' mind
 welcomes telleth every one
 joy thoughts arrival find
 duke godfrey wist knights gone
 within breast wiser soul divined
 hard mishap upon friends light
 sighed day wept night

 lxxxvi
 messenger thus mused drew near
 soiled dust sweat quite breath
 seemed man heavy tidings bear
 upon looks sate news loss death
 "my lord" quoth "so many ships appear
 sea neptune bears load uneath
 egypt come lets thee weet
 william lord admiral genoa fleet

 lxxxvii
 "besides convoy coming shore
 victual noble camp thine
 surprised lost store
 mules horses camels laden corn wine
 thy servants fought till could fight
 slain captives made fine
 arabian outlaws assailed night
 least feared least looked fight

 lxxxviii
 "their frantic boldness doth presume far
 many christians falsely slain
 like raging flood spared
 overflow country field plain
 send therefore strong troops men war
 force hence drive home
 keep ways tents thine
 broad seas seas palestine"

 lxxxix
 mouth mouth heavy rumor spread
 misfortunes dispersed wide
 among soldiers great amazement bred
 famine doubt new come foes beside
 duke saw wonted courage fled
 place thereof weak fear espied
 merry looks cheerful words spake
 make heart courage take

 xc
 "you champions bold 'scaped
 many dangers hard assays
 still god keep defend save
 battles combats fights frays
 subdued turks persians brave
 thirst hunger held scorn always
 vanquished hills seas heat cold
 shall vain reports appal courage bold

 xci
 "that lord helped every need
 aught befell glorious camp amiss
 shall fortune actions well speed
 mercy large extended
 tofore tomb conquering hands spreed
 delight remember
 strong therefore keep valors high
 honor conquest fame victory"

 xcii
 hopes half dead courage wellnigh lost
 revived brave speeches guide
 breast thousand cares tost
 although sorrows could wisely hide
 studied feed mighty host
 great scarceness force provide
 egyptian warriors sly
 subdue thieves araby



 sixth book

 argument
 argantes calls christians
 otho chosen doth strength assay
 saddle tumbleth dust
 captive town sent away
 tancred begins new fight trust
 win praise palm night ends fray
 erminia hopes cure wounded knight
 city armed rides night



 better hopes recomforted
 lay besieged sacred town
 new supply late victualled
 night obscured earth shadows brown
 armes engines walls spread
 slings cast stones tumble
 side northward lies
 high rampiers strong bulwarks fortifies

 ii
 wary king commands
 build tower make bulwark strong
 whether sun moon stars appear
 give time work time comes wrong
 every street new weapons forged
 cunning smiths sweating labor long
 thus careful prince provision made
 argantes came boasting said

 iii
 "how long shall like prisoners chains
 captived lie inclosed within wall
 see workmen taking endless pains
 make new weapons use
 meanwhile western thieves destroy plains
 towns burnt forts castles fall
 yet none us dares gates outpeep
 sound one trumpet shrill break sleep

 iv
 "their time feasting good cheer spend
 dare banquets sweet molest
 days night likewise bring end
 peace assurance quiet ease rest
 must yield hunger soon shend
 make peace save lives request
 else th' egyptian army stay long
 like cowards die within fortress strong

 v
 "yet never shall courage great consent
 vile death end noble days
 mine arms within walls ypent
 tomorrow's sun shall spread timely rays
 let sacred heavens dispose bent
 frail life yet withouten praise
 valor prowess might argantes shall
 inglorious die unrevenged fall

 vi
 "but roots wonted chivalry
 quite dead princely breast within
 devise frame praise die
 live conquer win
 let us together gates outfly
 skirmish bold bloody fight begin
 last need desperation driveth
 dareth wisest counsel giveth

 vii
 "but field wisdom dare venture
 hazard troops doubtful fight
 bind godfrey indenture
 end quarrels one single knight
 christian accord shall enter
 better say know right
 weapons place time shall choose
 let best vantage use

 viii
 "for though foe hands like hector strong
 heart unfeared courage stern stout
 yet misfortune justice wrong
 wanteth shall arm help
 spite fate shall right hand ere long
 return victorious hereof doubt
 take pledge wherein trust
 shall defend kingdom save"

 ix
 "bold youth" tyrant thus began speak
 "although withered seem age years
 yet old arms faint weak
 hoar head full doubts fears
 whenas death vital thread shall break
 shall courage hear death hears
 aladine lived king knight
 fair morn evening bright

 x
 "but yet would blazed
 thee secret shall told spoken
 great soliman nice far ypraised
 revenged sceptre broken
 men arms araby hath raised
 inde africk give token
 attends favor friendly night
 victual us foes fight

 xi
 "now though godfredo hold warlike feat
 castles poor forts vile oppression
 care still princely seat
 stately town keep possession
 thou appease calm courage great
 thy bosom make hot impression
 stay fit time betide ere long
 increase thy glory revenge wrong"

 xii
 saracen inly spited
 soliman's great worth long envied
 hear praised thus naught delighted
 king upon aid relied
 "within power sir king" says "united
 peace war shall denied
 turk arabian band
 lost shall defend land

 xiii
 "perchance comes heavenly messenger
 sent set pagan people free
 let argantes take care
 sword trust shall well safeconduct
 rest forces spare
 go forth war least agree
 though champion yet private knight
 christian prove single fight"

 xiv
 king replied "though thy force might
 reserved better time use
 yet thou challenge renowned knight
 among christians bold refuse"
 warrior breathing desire fight
 herald called said "go tell news
 godfrey's self western lords
 hearings boldly say words

 xv
 "say knight holds great disdain
 thus closed secret mew
 sword open field maintain
 dare deny words true
 devotion falsely feign
 hath moved french countries subdue
 vile ambition pride's hateful vice
 desire rule spoil covetice

 xvi
 "and fight prest
 one two dare defend cause
 come fourth fifth come rest
 come weapon draws
 let yields obey victor's hest
 wills lore mighty mars laws"
 challenge fierce pagan sent
 herald donned coatofarms went

 xvii
 man presence came
 princely godfrey captains bold
 "my lord" quoth "may withouten blame
 grace message brave unfold"
 "thou mayest" answered "we approve
 withouten fear thine ambassage told"
 "then" quoth herald "shall highness see
 ambassage sharp pleasing be"

 xviii
 challenge gan large expose
 mighty threats high terms glorious words
 every side angry murmur rose
 wrath moved knights lords
 godfrey spake said "the man hath chose
 hard exploit feels swords
 trust shall far entreat knight
 excuse fourth fifth fight

 xix
 "but let come prove field grant
 wrong treason let doubt fear
 shall pay glorious vaunt
 without guile vantage swear
 herald turned ended scant
 hasted back way came whileare
 stayed aught forslowed pace
 till bespake argantes face face

 xx
 "arm lord" said "your bold defies
 brave foes accepted boldly
 combat neither high low denies
 ten thousand wish meet green
 thousand frowned angry flaming eyes
 shaked rage swords weapons keen
 field safely granted guide"
 said champion armor cried

 xxi
 armed heart ire nigh brake
 yearned courage hot foes find
 king fair clorinda present spake
 "if go forth remain behind
 soldiers best thousand take
 guard person assigned
 yet let meet alone christian knight
 stand aloof two fight"

 xxii
 thus spake king soon without abode
 troop went forth shining armor clad
 rest pagan champion rode
 wonted arms ensigns
 goodly plain displayed wide broad
 city camp spread
 place like wherein proud rome beheld
 forward young men manage spear shield

 xxiii
 alone argantes took stand
 defying christ servants true
 stature stomach strength hand
 pride presumption dreadful show
 encelade like phlegrean strand
 huge giant jesse's infant slew
 fierce semblant esteemed light
 knew else feared might

 xxiv
 yet one godfrey singled
 undertake hardy enterprise
 prince tancred saw rout
 fixed wishes cast eyes
 spied gazing round
 though honor prowess lies
 whispered louder meant
 godfrey heard saw content

 xxv
 rest gave place every one descried
 chieftain's incline
 "tancred" quoth "i pray thee calm pride
 abate rage yonder saracine"
 longer would chosen champion bide
 face joy eyes gladness shine
 helm took ready steed bestrode
 guarded trusty friends forth rode

 xxvi
 scantly spurred courser swift
 near plain proud argantes stayed
 unawares eyes chanced lift
 hill beheld warlike maid
 white snow upon alpine clift
 virgin shone silver arms arrayed
 vental high descried
 goodly visage beauty's pride

 xxvii
 saw pagan stood stared
 looks would foeman kill
 full thoughts forward fared
 sent looks hill
 gesture troubled soul declared
 last marble rock standeth still
 stone cold without within burnt love's flame
 quite forgot came

 xxviii
 challenger yet saw none appear
 made sign show came
 "how long" cried "shall attend
 dares none come forth dares none fortune trust"
 stood amazed love stopped ear
 thinks cupid think mars lust
 forth stert otho bold took field
 gentle knight god danger shield

 xxix
 youth one late desired
 vainglorious boaster fought
 tancred chosen retired
 slackness awhile admired
 saw elsewhere employed thought
 though chosen proffered
 boldly took fit occasion offered

 xxx
 tiger panther spotted leopard
 runs half swift forests wild among
 young champion hasted thitherward
 attending saw pagan strong
 tancredi started noise heard
 waked sleep dreamed long
 "oh stay" cried "to belongs war"
 cried late otho gone far

 xxxi
 full fury anger despite
 stayed horse waxed red shame
 fight disgraced quite
 thought another played game
 meanwhile saracen hugely smite
 otho's helm requite
 foe quite sevenfold targe bear
 breastplate stuck broke spear

 xxxii
 encounter upon tender grass
 steed christian backward fell
 yet proud foe strong sturdy
 shook staggered sell
 knight lay full low alas
 high disdain thus gan tell
 "yield thee slave thine honor
 thou may'st report thou hast encountered me"

 xxxiii
 "not so" quoth "pardy guise
 christian knights though fall'n soon yield
 fall excuse better wise
 revenge shame die field"
 great circassian bent frowning eyes
 like grim visage minerva's shield
 "then learn" quoth "what force argantes useth
 fool proffered grace refuseth"

 xxxiv
 spurred horse speed haste
 forgetting good knights virtue owe
 otho fury shunned passed
 right side reached noble blow
 wide wound blood outstreamed fast
 side fell stirrup low
 avails hurt wounds augment
 foe's fierce courage strength hardiment

 xxxv
 argantes nimbly turned ready steed
 ere foe wist well aware
 side drove courser's head
 force could gainst great might prepare
 weak feeble joints courage dead
 heart amazed paleness showed care
 tender side gainst hard earth cast
 shamed first fall bruised last

 xxxvi
 victor spurred lightfoot steed
 made passage otho's heart
 cried "these fools thus foot tread
 dare contend equal mart"
 tancred anger shook noble head
 grieved unknightly part
 fault slow
 double valor would salve sore

 xxxvii
 forward galloped fast loudly cried
 "villain" quoth "thy conquest thy shame
 praise honor shall fact betide
 gain guerdon shall befall
 among arabian thieves thy face go hide
 far resort men worth fame
 else woods mountains wild night
 savage beasts employ thy savage might"

 xxxviii
 pagan patience never knew used
 trembling ire sandy locks tore
 lips flew sound confused
 lions make deserts thick roar
 clouds together crushed bruised
 pour tempest caspian shore
 speech imperfect stopped broken
 roared thundered spoken

 xxxix
 threats whetted keen
 eager rage fury spite ire
 turned steeds left large space
 make forces greater 'proaching nigher
 terms warlike worthy
 sacred muse haughty thoughts inspire
 make trumpet slender quill
 thunder furious combat shrill

 xl
 sons mavors bore instead spears
 two knotty masts none could lift
 foaming steed fast master bears
 never beast bird shaft flew half swift
 fury boreas tears
 shattered crags taurus' northern clift
 upon helms lances long broke
 heaven flew splinters sparks smoke

 xli
 shock made towers turrets quake
 woods mountains nigh hand resound
 yet could force fury shake
 valiant champions persons wound
 together hurtled steeds brake
 other's neck riders lay ground
 great masters war's dreadful art
 plucked forth swords soon earth start

 xlii
 close surest ward warrior lieth
 wisely guides hand foot eye
 blow proveth defence trieth
 traverseth retireth presseth nigh
 strikes falsifieth
 blow wardeth lets slip
 advantage oft lets part
 discovered seem thus art deludeth art

 xliii
 pagan ill defenced sword targe
 tancredi's thigh supposed espied
 reaching forth gainst weapon large
 quite naked foe leaves leftside
 tancred avoideth quick furious charge
 gave eke wound deep sore wide
 done safe ward retired
 courage praised skill admired

 xliv
 proud circassian saw streaming blood
 wound fountain running
 sighed rage trembled stood
 blamed fortune folly want cunning
 lift sword aloft ire nigh wood
 forward rushed tancred fury shunning
 sharp thrust pagan hit
 broad shoulder arm knit

 xlv
 like bear pierced dart
 within secret woods flieth
 bites senseless weapon mad smart
 seeking revenge till unrevenged dieth
 mad argantes fared proud heart
 wound upon wound shame shame espieth
 desire vengeance o'ercame senses
 forgot dangers defences

 xlvi
 uniting force extreme endless wrath
 supporting youth strength untired
 thundering blows fast layeth
 skies earth flying sparkles fired
 foe strike one blow leisure hath
 scantly breathed though oft desired
 warlike skill cunning waste
 argantes' force haste

 xlvii
 long time tancredi vain attended
 huge storm overblow pass
 blows mighty target well defended
 fell beside wounded deep grass
 saw tempest never ended
 paynim's force aught weaker
 high advanced cutting sword length
 rage rage opposed strength strength

 xlviii
 wrath bore sway art reason fail
 fury new force courage new supplies
 armors forged metal frail
 every side thereof huge cantels flies
 land strewed plate mail
 earth warm blood lies
 rush every blow smote
 thunder noise sparks seemed lightning hot

 xlix
 christian people pagans gazed
 fierce combat wishing oft end
 twixt hope fear stood long time amazed
 see knights assail eke defend
 yet neither sign made noise raised
 issue fight attend
 stood still life sense wanted
 save hearts within bosoms panted

 l
 tired wellnigh spent
 blows show greater power wound
 night gentle daughter darkness sent
 friendly shade overspread ground
 two heralds fighting champions went
 part fray laws arms bound
 aridens born france wise pindore
 man brought challenge proud

 li
 men sceptres interpose
 doubtful hazards uncertain fight
 privilege hath ever
 law nations doth defend right
 pindore began "stay stay warriors keen
 equal honor equal might
 forbear combat deem best
 give night due grant persons rest

 lii
 "man goeth forth labor sun
 night creatures draw sleep
 yet hidden praise darkness
 valiant heart noble knight takes keep"
 argantes answered "the fight begun
 forbear doth wound heart right deep
 yet stay christian swear
 meet here"

 liii
 "i swear" quoth tancred "but swear thou likewise
 make return thy prisoner eke thee
 else achievement enterprise
 none time expect me"
 thus swore heralds devise
 time exploit fittest
 wounds rest cure need
 meet sixth day decreed

 liv
 fight deep imprinted hearts
 saw bloody fray ending brought
 horror great possessed weaker parts
 made shrink combat thought
 much speech praise high desarts
 brave champions nobly fought
 knightly worth ypraised
 doubt disputation raised

 lv
 long see end doubtful fray
 favor wish success
 hope true virtue shall obtain day
 trust fury strength hardiness
 erminia burden lay
 whose looks trouble fear express
 dangerous combat's doubtful end
 joy comfort hope life depend

 lvi
 sole daughter hapless king
 proud antioch late wore crown
 christian soldiers tancredi bring
 sacked spoiled glorious town
 good virtue spring
 virgin's honor saved renown
 city state lost
 person loved honored

 lvii
 honored served leave gave
 willed go whither list
 gold jewels care save
 restored nothing missed
 beheld youth person brave
 deed noble mind wist
 laid ope heart cupid's shaft hit
 never knots love surer knit

 lviii
 body free captivated heart
 love keys prison bear
 prepared go death part
 kind lord prison dear
 thou honor esteemed art
 chiefest virtue noble ladies wear
 enforcest wend
 aladine mother's dearest friend

 lix
 sion princess entertained
 old tyrant mother dear
 whose loss soon woful damsel plained
 grief lived half year
 yet banishment loss friends constrained
 hapless maid passions forbear
 though exceeding woe grief
 sorrows yet love chief

 lx
 silly maid secret longing pined
 hope mote drawn phoebus' rays
 love mountain seemed whereon bright shined
 fresh memory tancred's worth praise
 within closet self shrined
 hotter fire tender heart assays
 tancred last raise hope nigh dead
 walls broad ensign spread

 lxi
 rest view christian army feared
 seemed number power might
 alone troubled forehead cleared
 spread beauty shining bright
 every squadron first appeared
 curious eye sought chosen knight
 every gallant rest excels
 seems love fancy tells

 lxii
 within kingly palace builded high
 turret standeth near city's wall
 erminia might ease descry
 western host plains mountains
 stood long day spy
 phoebus' rising evening fall
 thoughts disputed praise
 every thought scalding sigh raise

 lxiii
 hence furious combat surveyed
 felt heart tremble fear pain
 secret thoughts thus fancy said
 behold thy dear danger slain
 suspect fear grief dismayed
 attended darling's loss gain
 ever pagan lift blade
 stroke wound weak bosom made

 lxiv
 saw end wist withal
 strong contention eftsoons begin
 amazement strange courage appal
 vital blood icy cold within
 sometimes sighed sometimes tears let fall
 witness distress heart
 hopeless dismayed pale sad astonished
 love fear fear torment bred

 lxv
 idle brain unto soul presented
 death hundred ugly fashions painted
 slept grief augmented
 sad visions thoughts acquainted
 saw lord wounds hurts tormented
 complained called help fainted
 found awaked unquiet sleeping
 heart panting sore eyes red weeping

 lxvi
 yet presages coming ill
 greatest cause discomfort
 saw blood deep wounds distil
 suffered could bide bear
 besides report longing ear fill
 doubling danger doubling fear
 concludes courage lost
 wounded lord weak faint dead almost

 lxvii
 mother taught
 secret virtue herb springs
 besides fit charms every wound sore
 corruption breedeth misfortune brings
 art esteemed times yore
 beseeming daughters great lords kings
 would surgeon knight
 heal skill sight

 lxviii
 thus would cure love cure foe
 must friends kinsfolk slain
 cursed weeds cunning hand know
 could augment harm increase pain
 abhorred revenged
 treason spotless person stain
 virtueless wished herbs charms
 wherewith false men increase patients' harms

 lxix
 feared among bands stray
 armed men often seen
 tragic end many bloody fray
 life full haps hazards
 made bold every hard assay
 feeble sex became ween
 feared shake every reed
 cowards courageous made need

 lxx
 love fearless hardy audacious love
 emboldened tender damsel
 wild beasts serpents glide move
 afric's deserts durst ride go
 save honor esteemed
 life body's safety told
 secret troubled thought
 doubtful combat love honor fought

 lxxi
 "o spotless virgin" honor thus begun
 "that true lore observed firmly hast
 thy foes thou didst bondage
 remember kept thee pure chaste
 liberty wouldest thou run
 lay field princely virtue waste
 lose jewel ladies hold dear
 maidenhood great load bear

 lxxii
 "or deem'st thou praise little prize
 glorious title virgin's name
 thou gad night giglot wise
 amid thine armed foes seek thy shame
 fool woman conquers flies
 refusal kindleth proffers quench flame
 thy lord judge thou sinnest beyond measure
 vainly thus thou waste rich treasure"

 lxxiii
 sly deceiver cupid thus beguiled
 simple damsel filed tongue
 "thou wert born" quoth "in desert wild
 cruel bears savage beasts among
 shouldest scorn fair citherea's child
 hate pleasures youth belong
 gods thy heart iron frame
 love neither sin shame

 lxxiv
 "go go whither sweet desire inviteth
 thy gentle knight cruel
 love heart thy grief sorrows writeth
 thy laments complaineth see
 oh cruel woman care exciteth
 save life saved honored thee
 languished one foot thou wilt move
 succor yet say'st thou art love

 lxxv
 "no stay argantes' wounds cure
 make strong shed thy darling's blood
 reward may assure
 doth thankless woman much good
 ah may thy patience endure
 see strength circassian wood
 horror amazement shrink
 future fight thou hap'st think

 lxxvi
 "besides thanks praises deed
 suppose joy comfort shalt thou win
 thy soft hand doth wholesome plaisters speed
 upon breaches ivory skin
 thence thy dearest lord may health succeed
 strength limbs blood cheeks thin
 rare beauties half dead
 thou may'st thyself restore

 lxxvii
 "so shall part adventures bold
 valiant acts henceforth held thine
 dear embracements shall thee straight enfold
 together joined marriage rites divine
 lastly high place honor shalt thou hold
 among matrons sage dames latine
 italy land one tells
 valor true true religion dwells"

 lxxviii
 vain hopes silly maid abused
 promised mountains hills gold
 yet thoughts doubts fears confused
 escape unseen hold
 watchman every minute used
 guard walls christians bold
 fury heat war
 gates seld never opened

 lxxix
 strong clorinda erminia sweet
 surest links dearest friendship bound
 used rising sun greet
 phoebus glided ground
 made lovely partner sheet
 hearts one one thought found
 aught hid virago bold
 except love tale none told

 lxxx
 kept secret clorinda heard
 make complaints secretly lament
 cause sorrow referred
 matter enough discontent
 like bird close imbarred
 tender young ones springing bent
 draw searcher nest
 cries complains needeth least

 lxxxi
 alone within chamber's secret part
 sitting one day upon heavy thought
 devising means sleight art
 close departure safest wrought
 assembled unresolved heart
 hundred passions strove ceaseless fought
 last saw high hanging wall
 clorinda's silver arms sighed withal

 lxxxii
 sighing softly said
 "how blessed virgin might
 envy glory maid
 yet envy shape beauty's light
 steps trailing garments stayed
 chambers hide valor shining bright
 armed rides breaketh sword spear
 strength restrained shame fear

 lxxxiii
 "alas heaven members frail
 lively force vigor strengthen
 silken gown slender veil
 might breastplate helm forego
 heat cold rain hail
 storms fall blustering winds blow
 withhold would day night
 pitched field private combat fight

 lxxxiv
 "nor haddest thou argantes first begun
 dear lord fierce cruel fight
 encounter would run
 haply ta'en captive might
 yet find furious combat done
 thraldom easy bondage light
 fetters mine embracements prove
 diet kisses sweet keeper love

 lxxxv
 "or else tender bosom opened wide
 heart though pierced cruel blade
 bloody weapon wounded side
 might cure wound love made
 soul rest quiet slide
 valleys elysian shade
 mishap knight perchance would move
 shed tears upon murdered love

 lxxxvi
 "alas impossible things
 wishes vain afflict woful sprite
 yield thus plaints sorrowings
 hope help perished quite
 heart dares much soars cupid's wings
 use armors bright
 may sustain awhile shield aloft
 though tender feeble weak soft

 lxxxvii
 "love strong bold mighty nevertired love
 supplieth force servants true
 fearful stags doth battle move
 till horns others' blood imbrue
 yet mean haps war prove
 stratagem devised new
 clorindalike fair harness dight
 escape town night

 lxxxviii
 "i know men gate ward
 command dare deny
 sort else could beguile guard
 way left try
 gentle love adventure hard
 thine handmaid guide assist fortify
 time hour fitteth best thing
 stout clorinda talketh king"

 lxxxix
 resolved thus without delay went
 strong passion rashly guide
 bright arms rafter hent
 within closet closely hide
 might unseen sent
 rest sleeveless errands side
 night stealths brought wished end
 night patroness thieves lovers' friend

 xc
 sparkling fires heaven's bright visage shone
 azure robe orient blueness lost
 whose wit reason gone
 called squire loved trusted
 maid faithful one
 part told post
 would depart juda's king feigned
 cause sudden flight constrained

 xci
 trusty squire provided needments meet
 journey fitting
 meanwhile vesture pendant feet
 erminia doft erst determined
 stripped petticoat virgin sweet
 slender wonder see
 handmaid ready mistress'
 arm helped though simple skill

 xcii
 rugged steel oppressed offended
 dainty neck locks shining gold
 tender arm feeble bended
 huge target presumed hold
 burnished steel bright rays far extended
 feigned courage appeared bold
 fast side unseen smiled venus' son
 erst laughed alcides spun

 xciii
 oh labor shoulders bear
 heavy burthen slow went
 maid see coasts clear
 mistress streets sent
 love gave courage love exiled fear
 love tired limbs new vigor lent
 till approached squire abode
 took horse forthwith forward rode

 xciv
 disguised went unused ways
 secret paths strove unseen gone
 watch meet sore affrays
 soldiers new swords weapons shone
 yet none stop journey essays
 place passage yielded every one
 bright armor helmet bright
 known feared darkest night

 xcv
 erminia though deal dismayed
 yet went goodly countenance bore
 doubted lest purpose bewrayed
 much boldness repented sore
 gate fear passage stayed
 heedless porter beguiled therefore
 "i clorinda ope gate" cried
 "where king commands late ride"

 xcvi
 woman's voice terms framed
 like speeches princess stout
 would thought horseback seen
 feeble damsel armed round
 porter obeyed
 trusty squire maiden sallied
 secret dales silent pass
 danger least least fear least peril

 xcvii
 fair adventurers entered
 deep vale erminia stayed haste
 recalled cause fear
 foremost hazard trimly past
 dangers new tofore unseen appear
 new perils descried new doubts cast
 way desire quiet brought
 difficult seemed erst thought

 xcviii
 armed ride among angry foes
 perceived great oversight
 yet would thought disclose
 came chosen knight
 purposed present rose
 pure spotless clean untouched mortal wight
 stayed therefore thoughts wise
 called squire thus gan advise

 xcix
 "thou must" quoth "be mine ambassador
 wise careful true diligent
 go camp present thyself
 prince tancredi wounded tent
 tell thy mistress comes cure sore
 grant peace rest consent
 gainst fierce love cruel war hath raised
 shall wounds cured torments eased

 c
 "and say hope trust hath
 powers fears shame scorn
 tell thus much whatso'er saith
 unfold make quick return
 place free harm scath
 within valley meanwhile sojourn"
 thus spake princess servant true
 execute charge imposed flew

 ci
 received discreetly wrought
 first watch guarded place
 wounded prince brought
 heard message kind gentle grace
 told left tossing thought
 thousand doubts turned speedy pace
 bring lady mistress word
 might welcome courteous lord

 cii
 impatient whose desire
 grievous harmful seemed little stay
 recounts steps thinks draws nigher
 enters speaks comes way
 grieved careful squire
 less speedy seemed e'er day
 lastly forward rode love guide
 christian tents hand spied

 ciii
 invested starry veil night
 kind arms embraced round
 silver moon sea uprising bright
 spread frosty pearl upon candid ground
 cynthialike beauty's glorious light
 lovesick nymph threw glittering beams around
 counsellors old love made
 valleys dumb silence shade

 civ
 beholding camp quoth "o fair
 castlelike pavilions richly wrought
 sweet methinketh blows air
 comforts heart soul thought
 heaven's fair face gulf sad despair
 tossed bark port wellnigh brought
 seek redress harms
 rest midst weapons peace amongst arms

 cv
 "receive let mercy find
 gentle love assureth shall
 among entertainment kind
 first prince tancredi's thrall
 covet led ambition blind
 father's throne install
 might serve lord dear
 content joy comfort were"

 cvi
 thus parleyed poor soul never feared
 sudden blow fortune's cruel spite
 stood phoebe's splendent beam appeared
 upon silver armor double bright
 place round shining cleared
 pure white wherein nymph dight
 tigress great helmet laid
 bore witness went stayed

 cvii
 fortune would christian band
 secret ambush closely framed
 led two brothers italia land
 young poliphern alicandro named
 forces watched withstand
 brought victuals foes untamed
 kept passage erminia spied
 fled fast swift steed could ride

 cviii
 poliphern whose watery eyes
 aged father strong clorinda slew
 bright shield silver helm spies
 championess thought saw knew
 upon hidden mates aid cries
 gainst supposed foe forth flew
 rash heedless wrath
 bending lance "thou art dead" saith

 cix
 chased hind course doth bend
 seek soil find ease goad
 whether craggy rock spring descend
 softly glide within shady wood
 dogs meet late wend
 comfort weak limbs cooling flood
 flies swift fled first
 forgetting weakness weariness thirst

 cx
 thought rest weary sprite
 quench endless thirst ardent love
 dear embracements lord knight
 marriage rites first approve
 beheld foe weapon bright
 threatening death trusty courser move
 love lord abandoned
 spurred speedy steed swift fled

 cxi
 erminia fled scantly tender grass
 pegasus light footsteps bent
 maiden's beast speed likewise pass
 yet divers ways fear went
 squire late returned alas
 tardy news prince tancredi's tent
 fled likewise saw mistress gone
 booted sojourn alone

 cxii
 alicandro wiser rest
 supposed clorinda saw likewise
 follow yet nothing pressed
 ambush still close lies
 messenger godfrey addressed
 accident advise
 brother chased naked blade
 clorinda's self else clorinda's shade

 cxiii
 yet could
 small cause reason suppose
 occasion great weighty must
 make ride night among foes
 godfrey willed observed
 soldiers lay ambush close
 news christian army went
 every cabin talked every tent

 cxiv
 tancred whose thoughts squire filled doubt
 sweet words supposed hearing
 alas virgin came seek
 sake life danger
 forthwith singled rout
 rode haste though half arms miss
 among sandy fields valleys green
 seek love galloped fast unseen



 seventh book

 argument
 shepherd fair erminia entertains
 whilst tancredi seeks vain find
 entrapped armida's trains
 raymond strong argantes assigned
 fight angel aid gains
 satan sees pagan's fury blind
 hasty wrath turn loss harm
 doth raise new tempest uproar alarm



 erminia's steed mistress bore
 forests thick among shady treen
 feeble hand bridle reins forlore
 half swoon fear ween
 fleet courser spared ne'er
 bear desert woods unseen
 strong foes chased plain
 still pursued still pursued vain

 ii
 like weary hounds last retire
 windless displeased fruitless chase
 sly beast tapished bush brier
 art pains rouse place
 christian knights full shame ire
 returned back faint weary pace
 yet still fearful dame fled swift wind
 ever stayed ever looked behind

 iii
 thick thin night day drived
 withouten comfort company guide
 plaints tears every thought revived
 heard saw griefs naught beside
 sun burning chariot dived
 thetis' wave weary team untied
 jordan's sandy banks course stayed
 last light laid

 iv
 tears drink food sorrowings
 diet unhappy night
 sleep sweet repose quiet brings
 ease griefs discontented wight
 spread forth tender soft nimble wings
 dull arms folding virgin bright
 love mother graces kept
 strong watch ward fair lady slept

 v
 birds awaked morning song
 warbling music pierced tender ear
 murmuring brooks whistling winds among
 rattling boughs leaves parts bear
 eyes unclosed beheld groves along
 swains shepherd grooms dwellings
 sweet noise birds winds waters sent
 provoked virgin lament

 vi
 plaints interrupted sound
 seemed thickest bushes proceed
 jolly shepherd sung lusty round
 voice tuned oaten reed
 thither went old man found
 whose right hand little flock feed
 sat making baskets three sons among
 learned father's art learned song

 vii
 beholding one shining arms appear
 seely man sore dismay'd
 sweet erminia comforted fear
 vental visage open laid
 happy folk heav'n beloved dear
 work quoth upon harmless trade
 dreadful arms bear warfare bring
 sweet toil sweet tunes sing

 viii
 "but father since land towns towers
 destroyed sword fire spoil
 may unhurt
 safety thus apply harmless toil"
 "my son" quoth "this poor estate
 ever safe storm warlike broil
 wilderness doth us safety keep
 thundering drum trumpet breaks sleep

 ix
 "haply heaven's defence shield right
 doth love innocence simple swains
 thunderbolts highest mountains light
 seld never strike lower plains
 kings cause fear bellona's might
 whose sweat toil dinner gains
 ever greedy soldier enticed
 poverty neglected despised

 x
 "o poverty chief heavenly brood
 dearer wealth kingly crown
 wish honor thirst others' good
 move heart contented mine
 quench thirst water flood
 fear poison therein thrown
 little flocks sheep tender goats
 give milk food wool make us coats

 xi
 "we little wish need little wealth
 cold hunger us clothe feed
 sons care preserves stealth
 father's flocks servants need
 amid groves walk oft health
 fishes birds beasts give heed
 fed forest spring lake
 contentment example take

 xii
 "time one hath doating time
 silver locks golden tresses
 country life hated crime
 forest's sweet contentment ran
 became mighty caliph's man
 though simple gardener
 yet could mark abuses see hear

 xiii
 "enticed hope future gain
 suffered long soul displease
 youth spent hope vain
 felt native strength last decrease
 gan loss lusty years complain
 wished enjoyed country's peace
 bade court farewell content
 latter age quiet spent"

 xiv
 thus spake erminia hushed still
 wise discourses heard great attention
 speeches grave idle fancies kill
 troubled soul bred dissension
 much thought reformed
 within woods dwell intention
 till fortune occasion new afford
 turn home desired lord

 xv
 said therefore "o shepherd fortunate
 troubles didst whilom feel prove
 yet livest contented state
 let mishap thy thoughts pity move
 entertain willing mate
 shepherd's life admire love
 within pleasant groves perchance heart
 discomforts may unload part

 xvi
 "if gold wealth esteemed dear
 jewels rich thou diddest hold prize
 store thereof plenty
 greedy mind might well suffice"
 trickled many silver tear
 two crystal streams fell watery eyes
 part sad misfortunes told
 wept wept shepherd old

 xvii
 speeches kind gan virgin dear
 toward cottage gently home guide
 aged wife made homely cheer
 yet welcomed placed side
 princess donned poor pastoral's gear
 kerchief coarse upon head tied
 yet gestures looks guess
 ill beseemed shepherdess

 xviii
 rude garments could obscure hide
 heavenly beauty angel's face
 princely offspring damnified
 aught disparaged labors base
 little flocks pasture would guide
 milk goats folds place
 cheese butter could make frame
 please shepherd dame

 xix
 oft underneath greenwood shade
 flocks lay hid phoebus' scorching rays
 unto knight songs sonnets made
 engraved bark beech bays
 told cupid first invade
 conquered ends tancred's praise
 passion's writ read
 mourned salt tears shed

 xx
 "you happy trees forever keep" quoth
 "this woful story tender rind
 another day shade maybe
 come rest lover kind
 trophies griefs see
 shall feel dear pity pierce gentle mind"
 sighed said "too late prove
 troth fortune trust love

 xxi
 "yet may gracious heavens attend
 earnest suit distressed wight
 entreat vouchsafe send
 huge deserts unthankful knight
 earth man eyes shall bend
 sees grave tomb ashes light
 woful death stubborn heart may move
 tears sorrows reward love

 xxii
 "so though life hath unhappy
 least yet shall spirit dead blest
 ashes cold shall buried green
 enjoy good body ne'er possessed"
 thus complained senseless treen
 floods eyes fires breast
 streams tears shed
 wandered far alas chance led

 xxiii
 followed footsteps traced
 till high woods forests old came
 bushes thorns trees thick placed
 obscure shadows
 soon lost tract wherein paced
 yet went way could aim
 still attentive longing ear
 noise horse noise arms hear

 xxiv
 breathing gentle wind
 aspen leaf shaked tree
 bird beast stirred bushes blind
 thither spurred thither rode see
 wood cynthia's favor kind
 last travel great pains got
 following little path heard
 rumbling sound hasted thitherward

 xxv
 fountain living stone
 poured clear streams noble store
 whose conduit pipes united one
 throughout rocky channel ghastly roar
 tancred stayed called yet answered none
 save babbling echo crooked shore
 weary knight last espies
 springing daylight red white arise

 xxvi
 sighed sore guiltless heaven gan blame
 wished success desire denied
 sharp revenge protested
 aught good mistress fair betide
 wished return way came
 although wist path ride
 time drew near must fight
 proud argantes vainglorious knight

 xxvii
 stalwart steed champion stout bestrode
 pricked fast find way lost
 valley musing rode
 saw man seemed haste post
 horn hung shoulders broad
 guise us tancredi crossed
 way gently prayed man say
 godfrey's camp find way

 xxviii
 "sir" italian language answered
 "i ride noble boemond hath sent"
 prince thought uncle's man
 course speed bent
 fortress stately built last see
 bout muddy stinking lake went
 arrived titan went rest
 weary limbs night's untroubled nest

 xxix
 courier gave fort warning blast
 drawbridge let within
 "if thou christian be" quoth "thou mayest
 till phoebus shine take thine inn
 county cosenza three days past
 castle turks nobly win"
 prince beheld piece site art
 impregnable made every part

 xxx
 feared within pile fortified
 secret treason enchantment lay
 known even died
 yet looks sign fear betray
 wheresoever chance guide
 strong victorious hand still made way
 yet combat must shortly make
 new adventures list undertake

 xxxi
 castle meadow plain
 beside bridge's end stayed stood
 entreated speeches vain
 false guide pass beyond flood
 upon bridge appeared warlike swain
 top toe clad armor good
 brandishing broad cutting sword
 thus threatened death many idle word

 xxxii
 "o thou chance brings soil
 fair armida doth sceptre guide
 thou canst fly arms thyself despoil
 let thy hands iron chains tied
 enter rest thee thy weary toil
 within dungeon shalt thou safe abide
 never hope see day
 thy hair age shall turn gray

 xxxiii
 "except thou swear valiant knights aid
 traitors christian crew"
 tancred discourse little stayed
 arms gesture voice knew
 rambaldo false maid
 forsook country religion true
 fort defender chief became
 vile customs stablished

 xxxiv
 warrior answered blushing red shame
 "cursed apostate ungracious wight
 tancred defend name
 christ aye faithful knight
 rebel foes subdue tame
 thou shalt find end fight
 thy false heart cleft vengeful sword
 shall feel ire thy forsaken lord"

 xxxv
 great name rambaldo's ears fill
 shook fear looked pale dread
 yet proudly said "tancred thy hap ill
 wander hither thou art dead
 naught help thy courage strength skill
 godfrey send thy cursed head
 may see armida's sake
 christ scorn make"

 xxxvi
 said day sable night turned
 scant one could another's arms descry
 soon hundred lamps torches burned
 cleared earth sky
 castle seemed stage lights adorned
 men play pompous tragedy
 within terrace sat high queen
 heard saw kept unseen

 xxxvii
 noble baron whet courage hot
 busked boldly dreadful fight
 upon horse long tarried
 foot saw pagan knight
 underneath trusty shield got
 sword drawn closed helmet bright
 gainst prince marched stately pace
 wrath voice rage eyes face

 xxxviii
 foe furious charge well abiding
 traversed ground stated
 though faint weary riding
 yet followed fast still oppressed near
 side felt rambaldo sliding
 forces employed
 helm hauberk bright
 thundered blows face sight

 xxxix
 members battery chief maketh
 wherein man's life keeps chiefest residence
 proud threats gascoign warrior quaketh
 uncouth fear appalled every sense
 nimble shifts knight betaketh
 skippeth defence
 rage trusty blade
 blows good resistance made

 xl
 yet quickness defence used
 prince work harm scathe

 heaped blows thrusts confused

 feared troubled bosom strove
 remorse conscience shame disdain love

 xli
 last careless foul despair made
 meant prove fortune ill good

 neither plate mail blow withstood
 wicked steel seized deep right side

 xlii

 great loudly rung sounding steel
 yet pierced helmet blow
 although owner twice thrice reel
 prince whose looks disdainful anger show
 meant use puissance every deal
 shaked head crashed teeth ire

 xliii

 dreadful terror fierce aspect
 threatened blow saw right plain

 kill fear coward pagan's heart

 xliv

 equal pace almost closed
 burning lamps extinguished

 cynthia's self dispeared gone

 xlv
 amid witchcrafts ugly shade
 could prince pursue chase
 nothing saw yet forward still made

 ere wist entered place
 ghastly noise doorleaves shut behind
 closed fast prison dark blind

 xlvi

 silly fish streams enclosed striveth
 shun fury avoid sway
 wherewith current whirlpool driveth
 yet seeketh vain finds way
 watery prison diveth
 force tides brought
 entereth thence issueth naught

 xlvii

 gate framed subtle train
 close without help human wight
 sure none could undo leaves
 doors bended might
 forces employed vain

 xlviii
 "within dungeon buried shalt thou spend
 res'due thy woful days years"
 champion list words contend

 gainst enchantment huge complaints rears

 "to lose brightness shining sun

 xlix

 view shining ray"
 thought proud circassian foe

 world tancred blame
 grief fault mine endless shame"

 l
 high spirits champion good

 lii

 mighty lords monarchs kings

 liv

 combat hard single fight

 i'll give flesh dogs meat"

 said upon steed mounted high

 "unworthy life judge coward swain

 "but tancred still bed

 dread dead fled

 fled thee thee exceeds might"

 took aim other's helm high

 shaked firmly sit

 lxxxvii

 thing seld befell man

 lxxxix

 xc

 waste strokes thrusts idle thrown
 yet pressed doubled still blows
 hits neither cares knows

 xcii

 xciii

 target forged skies

 wondering christian's armor good

 xciv

 broke hardness county's shield

 xcvi

 within arms longing foe strain

 xcvii

 xcviii

 well armed better hearted scorns power
 like tall ship spent sails

 whose mighty ribs fast bound bands nails

 whose stern blast ruth grace finds

 xcix

 like armor weed

 looks speech gesture pace

 c

 whose show shape

 cii

 civ
